greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of parts in the k-th column of the partitions of n but with the partitions aligned to the right margin.
example: For n = 6 the partitions of 6 aligned to the right margin look like this:
The number of parts in columns 1-6 are
.  1,  2,  4,  7, 10, 11, the same as the 6th row of triangle.
xref: Mirror of A058399. Row sums give A006128. Right border gives A000041, n >= 1. Rows converge to A000070.
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Apr 22 2012
